paper_metadata.title: Atrial Fibrillation and Central Nervous Complications in Liver Transplanted Hereditary Transthyretin Amyloidosis Patients
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val30Met, including penetrance data and individual patient records.

patients.demographics: Median age at onset 45 years (range, 25-66 years); Median age at LTx 50 years (range, 27-69 years)
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRm) with CNS complications and atrial fibrillation

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Twenty-five patients had developed 1 or more CNS complications at a median of 21 years after onset of disease.
The remaining 38 patients did not develop CNS complications.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation in TTR is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to amyloid deposition and various complications.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met variant is known to segregate with disease in families affected by hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The study focused on patients with the Val30Met mutation specifically.
key_quotes: The estimated median survival from onset of disease was 27 years for the 63 included patients.
Twenty-five (40%) patients had developed 1 or more CNS event.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was primarily focused on the Val30Met variant in the TTR gene.
